Indeed, the higher points of what is called Calvinism, are far less insisted on, and the opponents of those points far more moderately censured than might have been expected 3 while the doctrines commonly called orthodox, as opposed by Pelagians, Arians, and Socin- ians, are strongly maintained, and the opposers of them strenuously, nay, severely, condemned. Even Mosheim allows that the triumph of the Synod was that of the Sublapsarians, not only over the Arminians, but over the Supralapsarians also.''<
